* Title: Data Structures and Algorithms
* Code: TIHT1101
* Credits: 3 (45 hours)
* Credit hours for teaching and learning activities:
+ Lecture: 25 hrs
+ Exercises on class: 10 hrs
+ Presentation and Discussion: 10 hrs
+ Self-study: 60 hrs.
* Parallel course(s): None

* Kind of the course:

Foundation □ | Foundation □ | Fundamental | Fundamental
Compulsory □ | Elective □ | Compulsory | Elective □
* Course language: 	In English
* Meeting hour: 8AM – 11AM on Wednesdays, Room 13.08, Building A1, National Economics University

Data structures and Algorithms are the basic course in the training program for students majoring in Management Information Systems, Information Technology and Computer Science. The course focuses on application areas and improves skills to help students grasp basic knowledge about algorithms and data organizations, which are the two most important elements of a computer program.
The course presents basic knowledge about common data structures and algorithms for processing that data. These are arrays, stacks and queues, lists, linked lists, trees, and graphs. The module also covers basic issues related to sorting and searching.

* Text Books/Lecture Notes:
[1] Han Viet Thuan and Nguyen Anh Phuong (2018). Data Structures and Algorithms, National Economics University Publishing House.

G2 | Have written communication skills; Write reports and make professional presentations related to plans, strategies and implementation of assigned activities; Have communication skills in the online environment. | PLO 7 PLO 9 | 4
G3 | Have the ability to work independently or participate in teams; have appropriate attitude and behavior related to safety and ethical standards in the field of information systems. | PLO 10 | 4

G1 | CLO1.3 | Understand the data structures of STACK, QUEUE, Linked-lists and analyze algorithms for processing list-type data. | T
G1 | CLO1.4 | Understand Tree data structure and analyze tree data processing algorithms. | T
G1 | CLO1.5 | Understand graph data structures and analyze graph data processing algorithms | T
G1 | CLO1.6 | Understand clearly about data sorting and analyze data sorting algorithms | T
G1 | CLO1.7 | Understand search and analyze search methods | T
G1 | CLO1.8 | Understand the concept of external processing and evaluate external processing algorithms | T
G2 | CLO2.1 | Have skills in designing and presenting algorithms, writing reports on analyzing and representing algorithms on data structures. | U

chunks.text:
- Students are responsible for attending all classes. In case of absence from school due to force majeure reasons, sufficient and reasonable proofs must be provided. For each absence, 1 point will be deducted 1 point. Students who miss any classes more than 3 times, with or without reason, will be considered as failing to complete the course and have to re-register.
- Students will be awarded points for constructive comments these points are added to attendance points and group assignments.
- Groups who do not submit the group work will receive a score of 0 (zero). Late submissions will be deducted for each day of late submission.
chunks.breadcrumbs: 9. COURSE REQUIREMENT & EXPECTATION > 9.2. Requirements for attending classes

chunks.text:
- The course is conducted on the principle of respecting learners and lecturers. Any behaviour that affects the teaching and learning process is strictly prohibited.
- Students must come to class on time. Students who are late more than 10 minutes after class starts will not be allowed to attend the class. Do not make noise and affect others during the learning process.
- Laptops and tablets are only used for the purpose of taking notes for and calculating for lectures and exercises, absolutely forbidden to use for other purposes.

9. COURSE REQUIREMENT & EXPECTATION
9.1. Requirements for taking final /terminal exams
- Students are allowed to take the final exam if their attendance score reaches 5 points or more (on the scale of 10).
9.2. Requirements for attending classes
- Students are responsible for attending all classes. In case of absence from school due to force majeure reasons, sufficient and reasonable proofs must be provided. For each absence, 1 point will be deducted 1 point. Students who miss any classes more than 3 times, with or without reason, will be considered as failing to complete the course and have to re-register.
- Students will be awarded points for constructive comments these points are added to attendance points and group assignments.
- Groups who do not submit the group work will receive a score of 0 (zero). Late submissions will be deducted for each day of late submission.
9.3. Requirements for in-class behaviour
- The course is conducted on the principle of respecting learners and lecturers. Any behaviour that affects the teaching and learning process is strictly prohibited.
- Students must come to class on time. Students who are late more than 10 minutes after class starts will not be allowed to attend the class. Do not make noise and affect others during the learning process.
- Laptops and tablets are only used for the purpose of taking notes for and calculating for lectures and exercises, absolutely forbidden to use for other purposes.
